question:
Which of the following is NOT an integral Component of the MS-Office 365 suite?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 16/06/2022 (Shift-III)
solution:
• MS-Paint is NOT an integral component of the MS-Office 365 suite.
  • MS-Office 365 primarily includes productivity applications like MS-Word, MS-Excel, and MS-Access.
  • MS-Paint is a basic graphics editing program that comes pre-installed with Windows, but it is not part of the Office suite.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is (d) MS-Paint.

Additional Information:

  • MS-Office 365 is a subscription-based service offering cloud-connected Office applications and productivity services.
  • It includes popular applications for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, database management, and email.
  • MS-Paint is a standalone application unrelated to the Office productivity tools.

question:
Which of the following is the shortcut for copying and pasting a file on the desktop?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Ctrl C + Ctrl V
option_2: Right click on file and click on copy + right click and paste
option_3: Ctrl X + Ctrl V
option_4: Ctrl Z + Ctrl Y
solution:
• The shortcut for copying and pasting a file on the desktop is Ctrl + C (to copy) followed by Ctrl + V (to paste).
  • This combination quickly duplicates the selected file without removing it from the original location.
  • Ctrl + X + Ctrl + V is used for cut and paste, which moves the file instead of copying it.
  • Right-click options also work but are not keyboard shortcuts.
  • Ctrl + Z + Ctrl + Y are Undo and Redo shortcuts, unrelated to copying/pasting.

Additional Information:

  • Using keyboard shortcuts improves speed and efficiency in file management.
  • Copy-pasting keeps the original file intact while creating a duplicate.
  • These shortcuts work universally across Windows operating systems.

question:
Which among the following is NOT an extension for a video file?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 20/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The extension .jpeg is NOT a video file extension; it is used for image files.
  • The other options, .avi, .mov, and .mp4, are common video file extensions used for various video formats.
  • Therefore, .jpeg is the correct answer as it represents an image format, not video.

Additional Information:

  • .avi stands for Audio Video Interleave, a multimedia container format.
  • .mov is a video format developed by Apple, commonly used in QuickTime.
  • .mp4 is a widely used multimedia format for video and audio streams.
  • Understanding file extensions helps in identifying file types correctly.

question:
_________ and __________ are the two kinds of sound effects files that can be added in Microsoft PowerPoint.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/01/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Wav files, mid files
option_2: Jpg files, pdf files
option_3: Wave files, jpg files
option_4: Doc files, gif files
solution:
• The two kinds of sound effects files that can be added in Microsoft PowerPoint are Wav files and Mid files.
  • Wav files are uncompressed audio files that provide high-quality sound.
  • Mid files (MIDI files) are music files that contain instructions for synthesizers to generate sounds.
  • Other options like JPG, PDF, DOC, and GIF are file types used for images, documents, or animations, not sound effects.

Additional Information:

  • Adding sound effects can enhance presentations by making them more engaging.
  • PowerPoint supports various audio formats, but Wav and Mid are among the most common for sound effects.
  • Understanding supported audio file types helps in preparing multimedia presentations.

question:
Which of these is NOT a part of the MS Office Suite?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Projects is NOT a part of the MS Office Suite.
  • The MS Office Suite includes applications like PowerPoint, Word, and Excel for presentations, word processing, and spreadsheets respectively.
  • Projects likely refers to Microsoft Project, which is a separate project management software and not included in the standard Office Suite.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft Project is used for planning, scheduling, and managing projects, but it is sold separately.
  • PowerPoint, Word, and Excel are the core productivity tools bundled in MS Office Suite.
  • Knowing the components of MS Office helps in understanding software capabilities and licensing.

question:
Which of the following keyboard shortcuts will you use to a previously opened program?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• To switch to a previously opened program, the keyboard shortcut used is Alt + Tab.
  • Pressing Alt + Tab lets you cycle through open applications and select the one you want to switch to.
  • Ctrl + Home moves the cursor to the beginning of a document.
  • Ctrl + N opens a new window or document.
  • Alt + Shift + Tab cycles through open applications in the reverse order.

Additional Information:

  • Holding Alt and pressing Tab repeatedly allows you to navigate through multiple open programs easily.
  • This shortcut enhances multitasking efficiency on Windows computers.
  • Knowing these shortcuts helps in fast navigation between programs.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a type of page margin?

RRB JE Stage-II 29/08/2019 (Evening)
solution:
• Center is NOT a type of page margin.
  • The common types of page margins are Top, Bottom, Left, and Right margins.
  • Margins define the space between the content and the edge of the page in a document.
  • Therefore, Center is not considered a page margin type.

Additional Information:

  • Setting margins correctly is important for proper document formatting and printing.
  • Margins help in ensuring the text does not get cut off during printing.
  • Understanding margin types is essential while working with word processors like MS Word.

question:
An additional margin added to a page layout to compensate for the part of the paper made unusable by the binding process is called:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The additional margin added to a page layout to compensate for the part of the paper made unusable by the binding process is called the Gutter Margin.
  • The gutter margin ensures that text is not lost or obscured near the binding edge of the printed document.
  • Other margin types like Narrow, Wide, and Mirrored have different purposes related to overall page layout but do not specifically account for binding space.

Additional Information:

  • Gutter margins are especially important for documents that will be bound, such as books or reports.
  • This margin is added to the side or top margin depending on the binding method.
  • Knowing about gutter margins helps in designing print-ready documents without losing content near the binding.

question:
Which one of the following is not an Office Package?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 20/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Quantum is NOT an Office Package.
  • Common office packages include WPS Office, Microsoft Office 2010, and LibreOffice.
  • Quantum does not refer to any known office suite or productivity software.

Additional Information:

  • Office packages are software suites that include applications like word processors, spreadsheets, and presentation tools.
  • Microsoft Office, WPS, and LibreOffice are widely used office suites.
  • Knowing office package names helps in software identification and selection.

question:
What is the industrial standard name of the first computer virus for MS-DOS?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The industrial standard name of the first computer virus for MS-DOS is Brain.
  • The Brain virus was created in 1986 and is considered the first PC virus targeting MS-DOS systems.
  • Other options like Heart, Veins, and Pulse are not related to the first MS-DOS virus.

Additional Information:

  • The Brain virus was developed by two Pakistani brothers and spread via infected floppy disks.
  • It marked the beginning of computer viruses targeting personal computers.
  • Knowing about early viruses helps in understanding computer security history.

question:
Which of the following is not a modified key in an IBM analog computer?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2017 (Shift-I)
solution:
• In an IBM analog computer, the key that is not a modified key is Tab.
  • Modified keys typically include Ctrl, Shift, and Windows key, which are used in combination with other keys to perform special functions.
  • Tab is generally a navigation key, not classified as a modifier key.

Additional Information:

  • Modifier keys alter the function of other keys when pressed together.
  • Knowing the difference between modifier and regular keys is important for understanding keyboard operations.
  • In modern computers, Tab is used for navigation rather than modification.

question:
What is the shortcut key Alt + Enter used for –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/04/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: Moving from one program to another
option_2: To show the property of a selected item
option_3: To open a new tab in a separate window
option_4: To force shutdown of the system
solution:
• The shortcut key Alt + Enter is used to show the properties of a selected item.
  • This shortcut opens the Properties dialog box for files, folders, or shortcuts selected in Windows Explorer or on the desktop.
  • Other options like moving between programs, opening a new tab, or forcing shutdown are controlled by different shortcuts.

Additional Information:

  • Viewing properties helps users check details like file size, creation date, permissions, and more.
  • It is a quick way to access item information without right-clicking and selecting Properties.
  • Knowing this shortcut improves efficiency in managing files and system settings.

question:
Which of the following commands does not affect the text font?

RRB JE Stage-II 28/08/2019 (Evening)
solution:
• The command that does not affect the text font is Border.
  • Underline, Italics, and Bold are font formatting commands that change the appearance of the text.
  • Border adds a line around the text or paragraph but does not change the font style itself.

Additional Information:

  • Borders are used to highlight or separate text sections visually.
  • Font commands directly alter the style of characters in the text.
  • Understanding these helps in applying the correct formatting in documents.

question:
Computer to a file type __________ can be identified by –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/01/2017 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A computer identifies the file type by the file extension.
  • The file extension is the suffix at the end of a file name, usually after a dot (e.g., .docx, .jpg, .exe).
  • Other options like file name, size, or destination do not specifically indicate the file type.

Additional Information:

  • File extensions help the operating system determine which application to use to open the file.
  • Recognizing file extensions is important for managing and organizing files efficiently.
  • Changing or removing file extensions can affect how files are handled by the computer.

question:
How to detect the file in a system of a computer?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• The most common way to detect or find a file in a computer system is by its name.
  • Searching by file name allows users to quickly locate files without needing detailed path information.
  • Other options like absolute path, file owner, or code number are less commonly used for general file detection.

Additional Information:

  • Modern operating systems provide search functions to find files using their names efficiently.
  • Knowing the file name or part of it can speed up the search process.
  • Absolute path specifies exact location but is harder to remember or use for casual searches.

question:
Which of the following is graphical software?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• Among the options, MS PowerPoint is considered graphical software.
  • PowerPoint is used to create presentations with slides that include text, images, charts, animations, and other visual elements.
  • Other options like MS Windows (operating system), MS Word (word processor), and MS Excel (spreadsheet) are not primarily graphical software.

Additional Information:

  • Graphical software focuses on creating, editing, or displaying visual content.
  • PowerPoint helps users design visually appealing presentations for communication.
  • Understanding the role of graphical software assists in choosing the right tool for visual tasks.

question:
‘.BAT’________ is a file extension for –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The file extension .BAT is used for Batch files.
  • Batch files contain a series of commands that are executed by the command-line interpreter in Windows or MS-DOS.
  • Other options like Binary files, Backup files, or Execution files do not specifically refer to .BAT files.

Additional Information:

  • Batch files are commonly used to automate repetitive tasks in Windows environments.
  • They are plain text files with commands written in sequence.
  • Understanding file extensions like .BAT helps in managing and running scripts efficiently.

question:
What does a computer have to decide for disk scheduling?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_1: Which disk should be accessed further
option_2: In which order the disk access request is to be fulfilled
option_3: Physical location where the files in the disk should be accessed
solution:
• For disk scheduling, a computer has to decide in which order the disk access requests are to be fulfilled.
  • Disk scheduling optimizes the sequence of read/write requests to improve performance and reduce seek time.
  • Other options like deciding which disk to access or physical file locations are not the main focus of disk scheduling.

Additional Information:

  • Efficient disk scheduling improves overall system speed and responsiveness.
  • Common disk scheduling algorithms include FCFS, SSTF, SCAN, and C-SCAN.
  • Understanding disk scheduling is important for operating system and hardware management.

question:
Which of the following hardware component database management is most important in the operation of the database management system?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_1: Hard resolution video display
option_3: High speed large capacity disk
solution:
• The most important hardware component for database management in the operation of a database management system (DBMS) is a high-speed large capacity disk.
  • Databases require fast access to large amounts of data stored on disks, making disk performance critical.
  • Other components like video display, printer, and plotter are peripheral devices and do not directly affect database performance.

Additional Information:

  • High-speed disks reduce data retrieval time and improve overall DBMS efficiency.
  • Large capacity is essential to store extensive databases.
  • Investing in good disk hardware enhances database operation and user experience.

question:
Which of the following is not an example of DBMS?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Apache is not an example of a Database Management System (DBMS).
  • Microsoft Access, Oracle, and MySQL are all popular DBMS software used to manage and organize databases.
  • Apache is primarily a web server software, not a DBMS.

Additional Information:

  • DBMS software allows users to create, manage, and query databases efficiently.
  • Apache serves web pages and handles HTTP requests.
  • Knowing the difference helps in understanding software roles in IT infrastructure.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a component of the Microsoft Office 2019 package?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Keynote is NOT a component of the Microsoft Office 2019 package.
  • Outlook, OneNote, and Excel are all part of the Microsoft Office suite.
  • Keynote is presentation software developed by Apple for macOS and iOS, not included in Microsoft Office.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft Office includes productivity tools for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, emails, and note-taking.
  • Keynote serves a similar purpose as Microsoft PowerPoint but is exclusive to Apple devices.
  • Knowing the components of Office helps in selecting the right software for your needs.

question:
.PNG file is a/an:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A .PNG file is an Image file.
  • PNG stands for Portable Network Graphics, a popular raster graphics file format that supports lossless data compression.
  • Other options like Audio file, Batch file, and Video file do not correspond to the .PNG format.

Additional Information:

  • PNG files are commonly used for web images due to their high quality and support for transparency.
  • Unlike JPEG, PNG does not lose quality when compressed.
  • Understanding file types helps in handling and using files appropriately.

question:
How can you insert a blank row at the top of a worksheet?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
option_1: Right-click on the row number and select Insert
option_2: Drag the mouse on the row border to select the row and click Insert in the Cells group on the Home tab
option_3: Click on the row number and press the Insert key on the keyboard
option_4: Click on the row number and press the Delete key on the keyboard
solution:
• To insert a blank row at the top of a worksheet, you can drag the mouse on the row border to select the row and then click Insert in the Cells group on the Home tab.
  • This action shifts the existing rows down and inserts a new blank row at the selected position.
  • Other options like right-clicking to insert or pressing the Insert key might work but are less precise or may require selecting the entire row first.
  • Pressing the Delete key removes data, not rows.

Additional Information:

  • Selecting the row by dragging the mouse ensures the entire row is selected for insertion.
  • The Insert option in the Home tab is a straightforward way to add rows or columns.
  • Knowing these methods helps in efficient worksheet editing.

question:
In Microsoft PowerPoint, what is the shortcut key combination to insert a new slide in a presentation?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In Microsoft PowerPoint, the shortcut key combination to insert a new slide in a presentation is Ctrl + M.
  • Pressing Ctrl + M quickly adds a new slide after the currently selected slide.
  • Other options like Ctrl + N open a new presentation, Ctrl + D duplicates the selected slide, and Ctrl + I is generally for italics in text.

Additional Information:

  • Using this shortcut speeds up the slide creation process during presentations.
  • You can customize the layout of the new slide after inserting it.
  • Familiarity with shortcuts enhances productivity in PowerPoint.

question:
In a spreadsheet, page orientation is changed through ___________.

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
option_1: page setup dialog box
solution:
• In a spreadsheet, page orientation is changed through the Page Setup dialog box.
  • The Page Setup dialog box allows you to select page orientation options such as Portrait or Landscape.
  • Other dialog boxes like Format, Print, or Paper do not directly provide page orientation settings.

Additional Information:

  • Changing page orientation affects how the spreadsheet prints on paper.
  • You can access the Page Setup dialog box from the File → Print menu or the Page Layout tab.
  • Understanding page setup options helps in preparing print-friendly spreadsheets.

question:
How can we add text to a slide in MS-PowerPoint?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In MS-PowerPoint, we can add text to a slide by using a Textbox.
  • A Textbox allows you to insert and format text anywhere on the slide.
  • Other options like Note box, Dialogue box, and Notes page serve different purposes such as adding presenter notes or system dialogs.

Additional Information:

  • You can insert a Textbox from the Insert tab on the ribbon.
  • Textboxes can be resized, moved, and formatted with different fonts and colors.
  • Knowing how to use textboxes helps in designing effective and visually appealing presentations.

question:
The process of merging data from a data source into a main document in a word-processing application is called:

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The process of merging data from a data source into a main document in a word-processing application is called Mail Merge.
  • Mail Merge allows you to create multiple personalized documents, such as letters or labels, by combining a template with data records.
  • Other options like data concatenation, accumulation, and integration refer to different data processes.

Additional Information:

  • Mail Merge is commonly used for mass mailing and form letters.
  • It saves time by automating the insertion of data into documents.
  • Understanding Mail Merge improves efficiency in document management.

question:
Which view in MS PowerPoint is useful for editing or formatting a single slide at a time?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The view in MS PowerPoint useful for editing or formatting a single slide at a time is the Normal view.
  • Normal view displays the slide you are working on along with thumbnails of other slides, allowing focused editing.
  • Other views like Reading view, Slide Sorter view, and Outline view serve different purposes such as presentation mode, arranging slides, or editing slide text outlines.

Additional Information:

  • Normal view is the default editing mode in PowerPoint.
  • It provides easy access to slide content and layout tools.
  • Familiarity with Normal view helps in efficient slide creation and modification.

question:
Which of the following extensions is used to save MS-PowerPoint applications?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The file extension used to save MS-PowerPoint presentations is .ppt.
  • .ppt is the standard extension for PowerPoint files created in versions prior to PowerPoint 2007.
  • Other options like .docx, .txt, and .doc are associated with Word documents or plain text files.

Additional Information:

  • In newer versions of PowerPoint (2007 and later), the default extension is .pptx.
  • Knowing the correct file extension helps in identifying and opening files with the appropriate application.
  • Properly saving presentations ensures compatibility and data integrity.

question:
When a new text document is created in MS-Office 2016, the default text size of the document is _____.

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• When a new text document is created in MS-Office 2016 (Word), the default text size of the document is 11 points.
  • This default size is set in the Normal style for body text.
  • Other options like 10, 12, or 14 points are not the default for a new document in Word 2016.

Additional Information:

  • The default font is usually Calibri, size 11, which offers good readability.
  • You can change the default font size by modifying the Normal style or setting a new default font.
  • Knowing the default size helps in consistent document formatting.

question:
Where can you find the options ‘From Beginning’ and ‘From Current Slide’ to run a slide show in MS PowerPoint?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In MS PowerPoint, the options ‘From Beginning’ and ‘From Current Slide’ to run a slide show are found under the Slide Show tab.
  • These options allow you to start the presentation either from the very first slide or from the slide currently selected.
  • Other tabs like Home, Slide Sorter, and View serve different functions and do not contain these specific slide show start options.

Additional Information:

  • The Slide Show tab provides various controls to customize and run your presentation smoothly.
  • Knowing where to start the slide show helps in presenting effectively.
  • You can also use keyboard shortcuts: F5 for ‘From Beginning’ and Shift + F5 for ‘From Current Slide’.

question:
Which key can be pressed to initiate a slide show in MS PowerPoint?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In MS PowerPoint, the key pressed to initiate a slide show is Function key F5.
  • Pressing F5 starts the slide show from the beginning (the first slide).
  • Other function keys like F2, F4, and F8 serve different functions and do not start the slide show.

Additional Information:

  • You can also start the slide show from the current slide by pressing Shift + F5.
  • Knowing this shortcut helps in quickly presenting slides during meetings or lectures.
  • Familiarity with PowerPoint shortcuts improves efficiency in presentations.

question:
The slide number can be added to each slide of the MS PowerPoint presentation from which of the following?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The slide number can be added to each slide of an MS PowerPoint presentation from the Footer option.
  • The Footer feature allows you to insert slide numbers, date, and other information at the bottom of the slides.
  • Other options like Page Formatting, View, and Table Design are not used for adding slide numbers.

Additional Information:

  • You can access the Footer option from the Insert tab under Header & Footer.
  • Adding slide numbers helps in easy navigation and referencing during presentations.
  • Understanding how to insert slide numbers improves presentation professionalism.

question:
In Microsoft Office, how is the font size determined?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• In Microsoft Office, the font size is determined in Points.
  • A point is a unit of measurement commonly used in typography, where 1 point equals 1/72 of an inch.
  • Other options like Pixels, Inches, and Centimetres are not the standard units for font size in Office applications.

Additional Information:

  • Using points allows consistent font sizing across different devices and resolutions.
  • Font size in points helps maintain readability and layout consistency in documents.
  • Understanding font size units is important for effective document formatting.

question:
Which shortcut key is used to paste a slide in Microsoft PowerPoint?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The shortcut key used to paste a slide in Microsoft PowerPoint is Ctrl + V.
  • Ctrl + V pastes the copied or cut slide into the presentation at the selected location.
  • Other options:
    • Ctrl + C is for copying,
    • Ctrl + P is for printing,
    • Ctrl + X is for cutting.

Additional Information:

  • After copying or cutting a slide, use Ctrl + V to insert it elsewhere in the presentation.
  • Knowing paste shortcuts helps in quickly organizing slides.
  • Keyboard shortcuts improve efficiency in PowerPoint presentations.

question:
What is the keyboard shortcut for inserting a new slide into an MS-PowerPoint presentation?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut for inserting a new slide into an MS-PowerPoint presentation is Ctrl + M.
  • Pressing Ctrl + M quickly adds a new slide after the currently selected slide.
  • Other options like Ctrl + S (save), Ctrl + X (cut), and Ctrl + N (new document) serve different purposes.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + M speeds up the slide creation process.
  • You can choose different slide layouts after inserting a new slide.
  • Familiarity with this shortcut improves efficiency in creating presentations.

question:
Icon commonly used to undo the last action in Word?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_3: A pair of scissors
option_4: A curved arrow pointing to the left
solution:
• The Undo icon is represented by a curved arrow pointing to the left , indicating reversal of the last action.
  • Clicking this icon on the Quick Access Toolbar or pressing Ctrl+ Z will undo your most recent edit.
  • It helps correct mistakes instantly without navigating through menus.

Additional Information:

  • The Redo icon (Ctrl+ Y) is a curved arrow pointing to the right , reinstating an undone action.
  • Icons like Trash Can , Pencil , and Scissors represent Delete , Draw , and Cut respectively.
  • You can customize the Quick Access Toolbar to add or remove the Undo icon.

question:
Option in Word to change case in reverse way?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Toggle Case switches each letter in the selected text from uppercase to lowercase or lowercase to uppercase , effectively reversing the current casing.
  • It’s accessed via Home tab→ Font group → Change Case dropdown → tOGGLE cASE .
  • This is quicker than manually retyping or using separate uppercase/lowercase commands.

Additional Information:

  • The Change Case dropdown also includes options like Sentence case, lowercase, UPPERCASE, and Capitalize Each Word.
  • Keyboard shortcut Shift+ F3 cycles through case options, including Toggle Case.
  • Toggle Case is useful for correcting text that’s been accidentally typed in the wrong case.

question:
Icons below the menu bar in word processor — what are they called?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In word processing applications, the set of clickable icons immediately below the menu bar is known as the Toolbar icons .
  • These icons provide one-click access to frequently used commands (e.g., Save, Undo, Print) without navigating through menus.
  • Toolbars can be customized , allowing users to add or remove icons based on their workflow needs.

Additional Information:

  • Format icons specifically refer to commands that change text formatting (bold, italic, font size), not the entire toolbar.
  • Shortcut icons generally denote desktop or filesystem shortcuts, not in application command icons.
  • In modern Word versions, the Quick Access Toolbar is a customizable subset of toolbar icons located above or below the ribbon.

question:
What does Orientation option in Word Page Setup allow?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: Page layout (portrait or landscape)
solution:
• The Orientation setting switches the page between Portrait (vertical) and Landscape (horizontal) layouts.
  • It’s located under Layout→ Orientation on the ribbon.
  • Changing orientation affects how the entire document or section is displayed and printed.

Additional Information:

  • Portrait is best for textheavy pages; Landscape works well for wide tables, charts, or images.
  • Switching orientation may require adjusting margins, headers/footers , and page breaks.
  • You can apply different orientations to different sections of the same document using section breaks.
